title: Hymnary Organâ€“Hymnal Crossover
text: All hymn and tune data sourced from Hymnary.org â€” a service of the Calvin Institute of Christian Worship and the Christian Classics Ethereal Library.

title: Hymnary Organâ€“Hymnal Crossover
text:
About This Project
All Souls Anglican Church in Ballito has an Allen organ with built-in hymns selectable from the console controller display. This project identifies which of those hymns also appear in the church hymn book, so the music selector knows exactly which built-in accompaniments are available for each service.

How It Works

Organ hymn list â€” We started with the 182 hymns programmed into the Allen organâ€™s console controller.
Tune lookup â€” For each hymn, we searched Hymnary.org to find which tunes are associated with it â€” many hymns have multiple tune settings.
Metadata collection â€” For each tune, we collected the title, composer, meter, musical incipit, key, MIDI files, and other metadata.
AI-powered filtering â€” We used GPT-5.2 to classify each tune as genuinely relevant or a search false-positive, running 3 independent checks with majority voting for reliability.
Hymn book matching â€” (Coming soon) Weâ€™ll cross-reference against the churchâ€™s hymn book to find which organ hymns match entries in the book.



Quick Stats



183 Organ Hymns




265 Unique Tunes




314 MIDI Files

title: Hymnary Organâ€“Hymnal Crossover
text:
Browse the Data
Head to the Hymnâ€“Tune Index to explore the full list of organ hymns and their associated tunes, or see the About page for methodology details and full attribution.






TipDownload the Data



ğŸ“¥ Download full dataset as Excel â€” a tidy spreadsheet with all hymnâ€“tune data, AI relevance classification, MIDI links, and metadata. Perfect for sorting and filtering in Excel.

title: About & Attribution
text:
All hymn and tune data on this site is sourced from Hymnary.org.
Hymnary.org is a comprehensive index of hymns and hymnals, operated as a service of the Calvin Institute of Christian Worship at Calvin University and the Christian Classics Ethereal Library (CCEL).
We are deeply grateful for this incredible free resource that makes projects like this possible.

title: About & Attribution
text:
All hymn and tune data on this site is sourced from Hymnary.org.
Hymnary.org is a comprehensive index of hymns and hymnals, operated as a service of the Calvin Institute of Christian Worship at Calvin University and the Christian Classics Ethereal Library (CCEL).
We are deeply grateful for this incredible free resource that makes projects like this possible.

title: About & Attribution
text:
Methodology

Input Data
The organ hymn list comes from an Allen organ console controller display, which shows 182 built-in hymns by abbreviated name. Each abbreviation was mapped to its full hymn title.
Some hymns have A/B variants (e.g., â€œAway in a Manger - Aâ€ and â€œAway in a Manger - Bâ€), indicating that the organ has two different tune settings for the same text. In these cases, we search once and present all matching tunes, sorted by prevalence.


Scraping Process
For each of the 182 organ hymns:

Search â€” We queried hymnary.org/search?qu={title}+in%3Atunes to find tune matches.
Tune detail â€” For each tune found in search results, we fetched the full detail page at hymnary.org/tune/{slug}.
Parse â€” We extracted structured metadata using BeautifulSoup (Python) from the HTML:

Tune title, composer, place of origin
Meter pattern, melodic incipit, key signature
Copyright status, number of hymnal appearances
Associated texts and alternative tune settings
Historical notes where available




Scraping Ethics
This scraper was designed to be respectful of hymnary.orgâ€™s servers:







Measure
Detail




Request delay
15 seconds between every request (3Ã— their robots.txt Crawl-delay: 5)


Caching
All HTML responses cached locally; pages fetched only once


Resume support
Pipeline checkpoints after every hymn; interrupted runs pick up seamlessly


User-Agent
Clearly identifies this as a personal church project


robots.txt
Verified compliance on 7 February 2026; only accesses allowed paths





Data Files
The processed data is available in the project repository:

data/processed/hymn_tune_index.json â€” Master index mapping each organ hymn to all associated tunes with full metadata
data/processed/tunes.json â€” Deduplicated tune dictionary keyed by slug
data/processed/summary.csv â€” Flat table for easy analysis

title: About & Attribution
text:
Hymn Book Crossover (Coming Soon)
The next phase of this project will cross-reference the organ hymns against the churchâ€™s hymn book index to identify which hymns are available on both. Stay tuned.

title: About & Attribution
text:
Technical Stack

Python 3.12 with uv for package management
BeautifulSoup4 + lxml for HTML parsing
Pandas for data processing
Quarto for website generation
GitHub Pages for hosting

title: About & Attribution
text:
License
This project is for personal, non-commercial church ministry use. Hymn data copyright belongs to the respective holders as noted in each tuneâ€™s metadata on Hymnary.org.

title: About & Attribution
text:
Contact
This project was built to help All Souls Anglican Church music selector identify which built-in Allen organ hymns match the church hymn book. If you have questions or suggestions, please open an issue on the projectâ€™s GitHub repository.
